=Introduction=
The core of this library is a transformation of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GEDCOM gedcom]http://gedcom2sem.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/wiki-images/icon_external_link_blue.png databases into [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resource_Description_Framework triples or statements]http://gedcom2sem.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/wiki-images/icon_external_link_blue.png. That allows flexible queries and reports. Various examples show various possibilities and techniques. Customize them to your wishes.

The fun part is to integrate your data with the [http://richard.cyganiak.de/2007/10/lod/ semantic web]http://gedcom2sem.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/wiki-images/icon_external_link_blue.png. 
The first that springs to mind is the results or sources of others family research. Dates and places are obvious entry points for other types of data: `GeoNames` for maps and `dbPedia` for an almanak.

Note that in the code the `publish` command still has to be renamed to `transform` as depicted in the diagram, see also issue 9. ==`GeoNames` versus `DbPedia`==

`GeoNames` does not have a sparql endpoint, therefore it has a different place in the diagram above than `DbPedia`. `FactForge` includes both `GeoNames` and `DbPedia`, but the merge causes trouble for the coordinates. Multiple values appear for the latitude and longitude in different formats and precision, no way to know their origin or even which belong together. Sometimes even latitude and longitude are mixed up, so in this case you have to download the data.

== `GeoNames` downloads ==

You may try to download the full [http://download.geonames.org/all-geonames-rdf.zip rdf dump]http://gedcom2sem.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/wiki-images/icon_external_link_blue.png if your unzip tool is powerful enough. Another option is to download place by place. You need to search for each place anyway to create [https://code.google.com/p/gedcom2sem/source/browse/trunk/src/test/resources/geoMashup.rules geoMashup.rules] to map URI's with the place name literals in your gedcom. The screenshot below shows the download link. The query [https://code.google.com/p/gedcom2sem/source/browse/trunk/src/main/resources/reports/mashup/mashup.arq mashup.arq] helps to check completeness of geoMashup.rules.
